articles.author: Rod Nickel
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney completed a comeback victory for the governing Liberals in Monday's election, positioning himself for a global role as a champion of multilateralism against U.S. President Donald Trump's more protectionist policies.
articles.title: Carney aims for global leadership role against Trump after Canada election win

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain and Portugal switched their power back on after the worst blackout in their history, though authorities offered little explanation for what had caused it or how they would prevent it happening again.
articles.title: Spain, Portugal switch back on, seek answers after biggest ever blackout

articles.author: David Ljunggren, Ismail Shakil, Rod Nickel
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney's Liberals staged a major political comeback to retain power in parliamentary elections, fuelled by a backlash against U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs and comments on making Canada the 51st U.S. state.
articles.title: Canada's Liberals benefit from Trump backlash to claim poll victory

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Olivia Le Poidevin, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: It took five hours of queuing at a community kitchen in Gaza's Nuseirat district for displaced grandmother Um Mohammad Al-Talalqa to get one meal to feed her hungry children and grandchildren.
articles.title: Short of supplies, Gaza's vital community kitchens may soon shut, halt free meals

articles.author: Jeff Mason, David Shepardson
articles.description: Trump's administration will alleviate some duties imposed on foreign parts in domestically manufactured cars and keep tariffs on cars made abroad from piling on top of other ones.
articles.title: Trump to sign order granting some auto tariff relief, White House says

articles.author: Fayaz Bukhari
articles.description: The government of India's Jammu and Kashmir territory has decided to shut 48 of the 87 tourist destinations in Kashmir and enhanced security at the remaining ones.
articles.title: India shuts over half of Kashmir tourist spots in security review

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: When Cardinal Jorge Bergoglio was elected in 2013 as Pope Francis, he was a near total Vatican outsider. He had never been a Vatican official, instead spending decades in local ministry. And he came from Argentina, the first pope from the Americas.
articles.title: Will Catholic cardinals pick another outsider like Francis to be pope?

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said that Ukraine had not responded to many offers by Russia President Vladimir Putin to start direct peace negotiations, and that it was unclear whether it would join a three-day ceasefire he has announced for next month.
articles.title: Russia says it's waiting for Ukraine's response to May ceasefire and offer of direct talks

articles.author: Christoph Steitz, Marie Mannes, Kalea Hall
articles.description: General Motors, Kraft Heinz and Electrolux on Tuesday joined the diverse list of companies that have pulled forecasts for 2025 or slashed outlooks, as U.S. President Donald Trump's trade war sends a chill through the corporate world.
articles.title: UPS cuts 20,000 jobs, GM delays investor call as Trump's tariffs create corporate chaos

articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: The U.S. administration may want to focus less on protecting Europe, but a military presence is too valuable for securing NATO's flank and projecting influence for it to pull out entirely, Estonia's defence minister has said.
articles.title: Too much at stake for US military to quit Europe, Estonian minister says
